nodes.bodyText:
I don't think these properties are needed. Those are just builder properties.
We need just the basic components of the URL like host, port, protocol, path, query, fragement, parameters. May be you can have an internal URL object

What if we say this as ServiceURL; This actually reflects service endpoints.
@pulasthi7 @mefarazath @omindu WDYT?
Remove  getters related to unnecessary operational properties
Don't return the list which is mutable. Rather return as properties, immutable list, or better to provide the capability to get a specific parameter given a key
Let's not use carbon utils and fetch. This object should be created with all necessary fields populated. Don't invoke other classes utils from this POJO
We need a slightly deviated version of this. Builder is the one who should process and get the POJO returned

Also would be better to have a parameter() method that allows adding params one by one.
Also shouldn't the input be a map?
Any reason for not using int?
Is this correct?
Why can't we have the primitive type
We can String as values right. Even if you take servlet API parameters are string isn't it
Same case applies here. I don't think it's necessary to have an object type
This is pending to implement ?
Shall we change the exception type
Should pick this up from OSGI service listening

+ * under the License.
+ */
+
+package org.wso2.carbon.identity.core;
+
+import org.wso2.carbon.identity.core.model.ServiceURL;
+
+/**
+ * URL Builder service interface.
+ */
+public interface ServiceURLBuilder {
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to add the URL context to the builder.
+     *
+     * @param context URL context.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addContext(String context);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with the tenant domain as a query parameter when
+     * operating in legacy mode.
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder appendTenantAsQueryParam();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with the tenant domain as a path parameter when
+     * operating in legacy mode.
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder appendTenantAsPathParam();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to add the proxy context path to the URL.
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addProxyContext();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to add the web context root to the URL.
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addWebContext();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with other parameters. Such parameters should be
+     * entered as <k,v> pairs.
+     *
+     * @param key   Key.
+     * @param value Value.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addParameter(String key, String value);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with fragments. Fragments should be
+     * entered as <k,v> pairs.
+     *
+     * @param key   Key.
+     * @param value Value.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addFragments(String key, String value);

nodes.bodyText: Can't we do this within getHostName() method
we would not have to resolve the context in this mode

We should not return the mutable map.
Make map unmodifiable. Also add a method get the value from the parameter key and a method to get just parameter names
Same above applies here

What if we build this at once with the constructor. Or build at first invocation.
There's no way these fields can change later as this class is immutable
Same above applies here
Let's not have this as a public methos
Can't we call, ServiceURLBuilder.create()

Intention of builder pattern is to write this code with less lines like,
ServiceURLBuilder.create().addPath().addParameter()
the respective API should validate for empty and null values

The builder components doesn't take in any parameters. So, for example, ServiceURLBuilder.create().addPath().addTenantQueryParam() gets called, the ServiceURLBuilder registers this as addTenantQueryParam = true
Since we don't know the value of the booleans in getServerUrl method, we have to perform a check for the boolean parameters before adding it to the builder.
Accept as varargs, so you don't need to tokenize

+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to add the proxy context path to the URL.

+     * entered as <k,v> pairs.
+     *
+     * @param key   Key.
+     * @param value Value.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addParameter(String key, String value);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with a fragment.
+     *
+     * @param fragment Fragment.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addFragment(String fragment);

nodes.bodyText:
From URL perspective there will be one fragment similar to query string. But we can have a method that accepts key, value pairs in a fragment, which might help building such fragments easily.
And above we can rename as setFragment which will denote that it will set the fragment component of the URL

+package org.wso2.carbon.identity.core;
+
+import org.wso2.carbon.identity.core.internal.DefaultServiceURLBuilder;
+import org.wso2.carbon.identity.core.model.ServiceURL;
+
+/**
+ * URL Builder service interface.
+ */
+public interface ServiceURLBuilder {
+
+    static ServiceURLBuilder create() {
+
+        return new DefaultServiceURLBuilder();
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to add the URL path to the builder.
+     *
+     * @param paths Context paths. Can provide multiple context paths with a comma separated string.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addPath(String paths);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with the tenant domain as a query parameter when
+     * operating in legacy mode.
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addTenantAsQueryParam();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with the tenant domain as a path parameter when
+     * operating in legacy mode.
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addTenantAsPathParam();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to add the proxy context path to the URL.
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addProxyContext();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to add the web context root to the URL.
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addWebContext();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with other parameters. Such parameters should be
+     * entered as <k,v> pairs.
+     *
+     * @param key   Key.
+     * @param value Value.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addParameter(String key, String value);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with a fragment.
+     *
+     * @param fragment Fragment.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addFragment(String fragment);

We can add multiple params right
What if we say 'addFragmentParams'

nodes.bodyText:
Why create a new hashmap here. It should be pre-initialized.
This avoids invoking this method multiple times and adding several parameters
Same above applies here
Is this the best way you can remove '/' from end. I think you can use charAt

Looked into this and found that setting the length in the above manner is more efficient than using stringbuilder.deleteCharAt(int index)
ref: https://stackoverflow.com/a/10131077/6113775
mmm but you are creating a string
This is not a resolving method. This a building URI/URL context
Better to log unresolvable host in message so that it makes the message more context aware
Shall we rename as 'getServiceURLBuilder'

nodes.bodyText: return an array
Why build a URI. Why not return from fragment variable

Went this way because the fragments are set in two ways. Either by setFragment(String fragment) where the fragment is set via a String, or by setFragmentParameters(String key, String value).. When the fragment is added via the second method, we don't store the fragment as a string before we encode it and append to the url. To resolve this, we can introduce a variable to store the fragment as a string before it is encoded and appended to the URL.

setFragement denotes -> fragement is fully replaced
addFragementParameter -> denotes key value par is added as to the fragment and you can call it many times to add.

remove unnecessary line.
Also, hope we checked that factory gets resolved from OSGi service level

nodes.bodyText: move primitive types for top for readability

I don't think this API should accept both fragment and fragment parameters.
Just keep the fragment here.
Build the fragment from builder class
In each of these methods we should check if the URL is built as expected. Null check is not enough
basically verify for absolute url, relative url and the respective component like fragment, parameter etc.

That is done in the ServiceURLTest class.
ref: 
  
    
      carbon-identity-framework/components/identity-core/org.wso2.carbon.identity.core/src/test/java/org/wso2/carbon/identity/core/model/ServiceURLTest.java
    
    
         Line 182
      in
      4d56695
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public void testGetAbsoluteURL(String protocol, String hostName, int port, String urlPath,
Then why check null. Shouldn't the expectation is to verify the path added

Should this check be here ?
Ideally it hostname here should not set with '/'. It should be validated at the URL builder level
Yes, will move it to the DefaultServiceURLBuilder class.
Having this public will be a problem. Looks like no option here though unless we move packages
Add more context info here
Shouldn't we return with an error code. @mefarazath what was the approach followed previously. Was it in API level we returned with error codes
Can there be a situation where we will have both the fragment string and fragment params?

The spec for URIs [1] says the semantics of the fragment are considered unknown and are effectively unconstrained. So, if we want to accommodate such a case, we can have it. But, we need to rethink the fragment structure then..
ref: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.5
Let's not have both. setFragment() denotes it overrides. Common practice followed
Can we make this a list or a set?

+    /**
+     * This method is called to get the protocol of Service URL.
+     *
+     * @return String of the protocol.
+     */
+    String getProtocol();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to get the host name of Service URL.
+     *
+     * @return String of the host name.
+     */
+    String getHostName();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to get the port of Service URL.
+     *
+     * @return value of the port.
+     */
+    int getPort();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to get the Url path of Service URL.
+     *
+     * @return String of the url path.
+     */
+    String getUrlPath();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to get the parameter value when the key is provided.
+     *
+     * @param key Key of the parameter.
+     * @return The value of the parameter.
+     */
+    String getParameter(String key);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to get a list of the parameter names.
+     *
+     * @return ArrayList of parameter keys.
+     */
+    String[] getParameterKeys();
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to get the decoded fragment from the url.
+     *
+     * @return The decoded fragment.
+     */
+    String getFragment();
+
+    /**
+     * Concatenate the protocol, host name, port, proxy context path, web context root and url context to return the
+     * absolute URL.
+     *
+     * @return The absolute URL from the Service URL instance.
+     */
+    String getAbsoluteURL() throws URLBuilderException;
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to get the relative url from the url context.
+     *
+     * @return The relative URL from the Service URL instance.
+     */
+    String getRelativeURL() throws URLBuilderException;
+
+
+
+

nodes.bodyText: New line at EOF
remove redundant code
It's fine for the builder to throw URLBuilderException while building the URL. But ServiceURL POJO should not throw it when getting absolute URL or relative URL
This is a long class to implement as an anonymous. Impacts readability
I don't think exceptions should be thrown from here

nodes.bodyText: Let's stick to one exception type. No need to re-wrap and throw. These are not two specific types we should declare. Rather you have been wrapping the same thing.

+package org.wso2.carbon.identity.core;
+
+import org.wso2.carbon.identity.core.internal.DefaultServiceURLBuilder;
+import org.wso2.carbon.identity.core.internal.IdentityCoreServiceComponent;
+
+/**
+ * URL Builder service interface.
+ */
+public interface ServiceURLBuilder {
+
+    static ServiceURLBuilder create() {
+
+        if (IdentityCoreServiceComponent.getServiceURLBuilderFactory() != null) {
+            return IdentityCoreServiceComponent.getServiceURLBuilderFactory().createServiceURLBuilder();
+        } else {
+            return new DefaultServiceURLBuilder();
+        }
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called to add the URL path to the builder.
+     *
+     * @param paths Context paths. Can provide multiple context paths with a comma separated string.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addPath(String ... paths);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with other parameters. Such parameters should be
+     * entered as <k,v> pairs.
+     *
+     * @param key   Key.
+     * @param value Value.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addParameter(String key, String value);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL needs to be appended with a fragment.
+     *
+     * @param fragment Fragment.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder setFragment(String fragment);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is called when the URL fragment needs to be appended with parameters. Such parameters should be
+     * entered as <k,v> pairs. These parameters will get appended with an "&".
+     *
+     * @param key   Key.
+     * @param value Value.
+     * @return {@link ServiceURLBuilder}.
+     */
+    ServiceURLBuilder addFragmentParameter(String key, String value);
+
+    /**
+     * This method is used to return a ServiceURL with the protocol, hostname, port, proxy context path, a web context
+     * root and the tenant domain (appended if required).
+     *
+     * @return {@link ServiceURL}.
+     * @throws URLBuilderException If error occurred while constructing the URL.
+     */
+    ServiceURL build() throws URLBuilderException, ServiceURLException;

Why we need to wrap this and throw ?
